conclusion: The problem involves determining the pressure of an ideal gas at a temperature of 600 K using the provided p-T and V-T graphs.
The graph on the left shows the relationship between pressure (p) and temperature (T) for an ideal gas. It is a straight line.
The graph on the right shows the relationship between volume (V) and temperature (T) for the same ideal gas. It is also a straight line.

premise: The graph on the left is a straight line.
conclusion: The pressure of the gas is directly proportional to the temperature.

premise: The graph on the right is a straight line.
conclusion: The volume of the gas is directly proportional to the temperature.
The ideal gas law states that the pressure of a gas is directly proportional to the temperature, and the volume of a gas is directly proportional to the temperature.

premise: The pressure of the gas is directly proportional to the temperature, and the volume of the gas is directly proportional to the temperature.
conclusion: The pressure of the gas when the temperature is 600 K is 1.5 x 10^5 Pa.
